body.name: Rescuing the Kidnapped Heiress: A Historical Western Adventure Novel

productInformation.name: Best Sellers Rank
productInformation.value: #6,785 in Kindle Store (See Top 100 in Kindle Store) #21 in American Historical Romance (Kindle Store) #29 in American Historical Romance (Books) #35 in Western Fiction Classics

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I have never read anything by Derek Levine before, OMG this was fantastic!! Raymond is a wealthy rancher, his granddaughter Hazel lives with him. Hazel is of the age to date, but she has had no suitors. Warren Fleming is a saloon owner, and a sinister gunslinger; who is obsessed with marrying Hazel so he can get Raymond's money. Warren goes so far as to kidnap her, to force Raymond to giving his blessing to marry her. Will Hazel be forced to marry Warren? Will Warren get Raymond's money? Love the plot, great setting, and strong intense interesting characters. I look forward to reading more from Derek Levine!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great western rescue novel
reviews.reviewText: Raymond with his beautiful daughter Hazel are pestered by Warren the owner of the local saloon for her hand in marriage. Isaac comes to town looking for a job as a gunman. Raymond has no openings and refers him to the local sheriff as possibly a deputy. Isaac is instantly drawn to Hazel but feels he has no chance with her. Much activity and action occurs to see the end of this western. I read as an ARC and highly recommend.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Hazel, granddaughter is to wealthy ranch owner, Raymond. Warren Flemming, local salon owner with little else to recommend him, although he has been asking her grandfather to court Hazel 4 years. Hazel did not like him.Isaac from Nevada territory reared on ranch where his parents died and his older brother inherited then promptly lost in poker game and shot shortly afterwards. Isaac traveled getting jobs along the way wanting to do law enforcement. Traveled into Crestview, Texas town where Hazel and her grandfather lived asking for work to be pointed to Raymond’s ranch. He did not get a job with the ranch, but provided reference to see sheriff in town. Isaac did see Hazel and love at first sight occurred.Instead of asking Hazel to marry Warren kidnapped Hazel with his plan of getting her grandfather’s money. After her grandfather read letter from Warren, although he didn’t sign it, he learns Hazel is taken to promptly hires Isaac to track her down and returned safely. Along the way Isaac learns lots of suspicious activity by Warren’s mercenaries or is Warren more involved? I thoroughly enjoyed this story! Story has so many trials and tragedy to get to an awesome ending.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Hazel and her grandfather live on the outskirts of town on the richest ranch in the area their life is great except for Warren the saloon keeper that wants to marry Hazel. She and her grandfather have told him no several years in a row but he wants the money that Hazel will inherit and goes about it by kidnapping Hazel. Isaac had been in town for a while and also liked Hazel. The ransom note said no lawmen so Isaac ended up going for Hazel and the rest is history. Great story!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Looking for the heiress.
reviews.reviewText: Warren has a false outlook on his future with Hazel. He’s crazy and her grandfather has kept her on the ranch, so she doesn’t have a learning or vision of the life outside of the ranch. Isaac is a gunfighter, but comes across as a towhead just out on his own for the first time. So for Isaac and Hazel it is “love” at first sight. He takes off looking for her with no idea where to go or where to look. He just rides off without as a single question. You can take it from there and figure out the problems he goes through and the crazy gun fight at the end. The author does have better books out. This book is written just a little to light hearted for a dark subject as kidnapping. It is an interesting read and some surprising character development.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great story line
reviews.reviewText: Really enjoyed this book... Was not thrilled with the villain in the story though. He was so dirty and underhanded trying to get Hazel to marry him just for her grandfathers money. What a greedy person and the kicker of it was he murdered his own mother and stepfather and lied to his step sister for years.. Started reading this morning and finished it tonight.. Great work Keep up your great stories..A fan Karen

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Old West Adventure
reviews.reviewText: A adventuresome western tale. I enjoyed this book very much and thought it was a fun read. A rich rancher, his kidnapped daughter and the man hired to get her back. It's a good western page turning tale.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This was an easy to read story without a lot of shooting and fighting. It was good but it seemed like it ended quickly. Not one of his best but worth the read.

reviews.reviewTitle: Her grandfather will not let her marry a man who only wants her for her money
reviews.reviewText: There is a man who wants her for her money and her body. And she despises him. He has a saloon . . .and he convinces one of her staff to befriend her at church. And then he kidnaps her. He tells her grandfather if he goes to the sheriff he will kill her. BUT there is a man who is determined to rescue both women!!! This is a superb book. Enjoyed it a lot.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 5, 2024
